item.name: 51st State
item.comment: First impression: superb grafics meets interesting gameplay in the veins of Race for the Galaxy or San Juan. The theme is not for everyone but I like it.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment:
First impression: Great drafting game with short playing time and wonderful grafics. Hope to play it alot in the near future.
Second impression: After 8 Plays it pleases me still. Eager to play again and again! Clearly on it's way to a modern classic!

First impression: Playing the game by the rules, you'll have nothing but a complicated version of Black Jack without money on the table! We quickly developed a simple variant, which was enjoyable for the short time it took. Will not play the game by the rules anymore, but maybe with the variant.
Variant: Offer one card OPEN to the first player. He can take it or pass. If he passes, other the card to the next player. If any player takes the card, but a diamond up the table and offer the next card to the player sitting left to the player who took a card last. If all player pass successively, the round ends and the diamonds will be distributed.

item.name: A la carte
item.comment: First impression: I owned the old edition for a short time, but never played it. Now it is updated with better and very nice material. But gameplay is so luckbased that i would categorize this more as a "social event" than a playable game. Nice to try it once in a while, for me not worth owning it.

item.name: Abalone
item.conditiontext: complete with rules in french, german, dutch and english. Components are like new, the box shows almost none shelf wear!

item.name: Acquire
item.comment: After recently playing this classic again, i reduced my rating from '7' to '5'. With equally exp. players, there is not much more than a luckdriven cardgame in it. I respect it's wonderful clear design but it's more a lesson in mordern capitalism theory than a game.

item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Alhambra
item.conditiontext: german first edition, named "Alhambra" and without the SdJ-Sign. Like new condition!

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: First impression: Nice dice game with shiny graphics. Interesting gameplay with alot of "take that" moments. Enjoyable!

item.name: Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet
Amerigo
item.comment: Kickstarted the game and really like it!

item.name: Amerigo Mini- Expansion 2
item.originalname: Amerigo Queenie 2: Cove Island, Bay Island & New Progress Tokens

item.name: Amerigo Mini- Expansion 3
item.originalname: Amerigo Queenie 3: Special Production Buildings and Tokens

item.name: AquaSphere
item.comment:
First impression: Got to play a preview edition, fresh out of production. Lots and lots of rules, this is one of the heavier Felds for sure, comparable to Bora Bora or Burgundy. The mechanics are more interwoven than in Trajan or Bora Bora, but there are lots of them, nonetheless. The first plays are only for learning all the interdependencies, playing with a plan is required, but hardly possible.
Thematically, the game felt flat for me. Nice bits representing Bots and Octopods didn't help much to feel like being in an Underwater Station. It could have been any other theme, but this is typical for an Euro game like this and no real problem.
Gameplay was quite fast, but we didn't do much planning also. I could imagine that playing with AP prone players this could be a very boring experience for me at last.
After all, I liked Burgundy and Trajan more, but would play AquaSphere again.

item.name: Asara
item.comment: First impression: Very nice and detailled artwork on board and cards by one of my fav. artists, F. Vohwinkel. The game itself didn't impress me, at least without the two "mini-expansions" (one gives you a chance of another cards, the other helps with the omnipresent ties). Overall, it feels that you don't have much control over your fate as you are dependent on the cards you get. I'm willing to give it a second try, but sadly don't expect a much better game.

item.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment:
Played the i-app a lot recently. I'm very glad i didn't bought the cardboard edition, it would have been a waste of money!
I did'nt like the double layer of luck in these kind of games. Not only you have to get/build a decent hand, all your efforts may be spoiled by the ever changing center row. On top you may add only indirect player interaction but awful lot (multi)player chaos.
It's nice to get time by with my iPhone, but really don't want to play face to face ever!

item.name: Assyria
item.comment: First impression: Nice presented game with a lot of interweaving mechanics. But it lasts too long for what it gives and is very, very dry. I'll try it again, but have no need to buy it.

item.name: Atlantis
item.comment: First impression: Too long and to thinkey for what you get. And boring.

item.name: Auf den Spuren von Marco Polo
Bangkok Klongs
item.comment: First impression: nice tilelaying game with lots of thinking going on. Not really my cup of tea - too long, too chaotic. But cute graphics and very good production quality!

item.name: Basari
item.comment: First impression: Plays a lot like the bigger boardgame, but that's a good thing!

item.name: Biblios
item.comment: First impression: Light card game with almost non-existent theme but good graphics. "The outguessing game" is a nice idea, but as lone mechanism weak.

item.name: Bison: Thunder on the Prairie
item.comment: Trade interest: high

item.name: Blood Royale
item.comment: Trade interest: low

item.name: Die Borgia: RÃ¤nkespiele in der Renaissance
item.originalname: The Prince: The Struggle of House Borgia

item.name: BrÃ¼gge
item.comment: First impression: At first glance, this is a very nicely produced luck-fest. You get working card combos. Or not. I'm not sure if it was really necessary to have onehundredandsixtyfive different cards in this game. Sure, some are very familiar to others so there are only so many different cards in it. Will try it again, but I'm not convinced now.

item.name: Die Burgen von Burgund
item.comment:
First impression after prototype play in Essen 2010: Would have been one of the hits of the show if you could have buy it! Great game of decisions and lots of ways to explore how to build your realm. Very eager to get my hands on it, sadly we have to wait until January 2011.
Second impression after some more plays: GREAT GAME! Really like the flow of the game, shines in 2-, 3- or 4-player games equally, thats a great thing. I think i like it more than MACAO, hope my SO will play it as much as MACAO with me!

item.name: Burgenland
item.comment: First impression: a true family game in the vein of Ticket to Ride. Collect cards, build for bonus, rinse & repeat. I don't like the cover, though.

item.name: Cable Car
item.comment: First Impression: Nice Rework of METRO, but no need to buy if you know/own the old game. The shares variant is nice, but lacks some tension.

item.name: Caesar & Cleopatra
item.haspartslist: almost complete german game, nine cards are missing.

item.name: Capone
item.conditiontext: box is good, some shelf wear visible; components are like new

item.name: Carcassonne: 1. Erweiterung â€“ WirtshÃ¤user und Kathedralen
Carcassonne: 2. Erweiterung â€“ HÃ¤ndler und Baumeister
Carcassonne: 3. Erweiterung â€“ BurgfrÃ¤ulein und Drache
Carcassonne: 8. Erweiterung â€“ BrÃ¼cken, Burgen und Basare
Cardcassonne
item.comment: First impression: Only played it once with two, the game was quite boring. Hope it's better with more.

item.name: Cargo Noir
item.comment: First impression: Lots of nice components, but no interesting game in this box! Bidding and set collecting were seen thousend times around here and the theme, although colorful and cute presentated, rises one's eyebrows. Smuggling things like uran and weapons? Come on, that was NO smart move, Days of Wonder!

item.name: Carson City
item.comment: First impression: Another worker placement title with some customizable randomness, duells of cowboys included. Nice gameplay, which rewards good strategy. Eager to play again!

item.name: Cartouche
item.comment: First impression: Nice tweak on deckbuilding games. Cards are a litte to small to be convienent, but playable.

item.name: Catan Card Game
item.conditiontext: german edition by Kosmos, complete and very good condition

item.name: City of Iron: Experts and Engines
Constantinopolis
item.comment: First impression: Nice presentation of wellknown mechanics blended in one game. Takes too long for what it gives and I don't like the order cards mechanic, which is not really planable. Will give it another try, but have only low hopes.

item.name: Craftsmen
item.comment: First impression: interesting mix of lots of different mechanics in one game, though maybe one or two mechanics less would have made a better game. This is the game HELVETIA (Kosmos, 2011) should have been! I definitively want to play it again, but only with max. 4 players and then only two years (8 rounds). The last year doesn't add much to the game, but drags on and on. A good player aid would also help alot, because almost every player made mistakes here and then.

item.name: Cthulhu Wars
item.comment: Kickstarter December 2013 - received February 2015

item.name: Dakota
item.comment: First impression: Played the prototype at Essen09. Nice mechanics and interesting twist in choosing between natives and colonists at the start of the game. Both have the same goal but different ways to achieve it. Played with three and liked it, could be even better with more!

item.name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Zoo-Wee Mama Card Game
Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment: First impression: Nice card-driven area control game with lots of (mostly negative) player interaction. Not for the "serious" strategy gamer, God beware! This is more for gaming families and Discworld-Fans alike. I find it surprisingly lightheartened and enjoyed my two plays so far very much!

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: First impression: Very nice presented game, much fun to play with the right people. Maybe not so great replayability?

item.name: Dominion: BlÃ¼tezeit
item.comment: First impression: Great expansion for an already very good game. Truely a must-have for all fans! Not rated a 10, because there must be room for even better expansions! ;-)

item.name: Drum Roll
item.comment: First impression: worker placement with a new, fresh theme and fantastic graphics!

item.name: Dungeon Fighter
item.comment: First impression: Funny dexterity game, best played with theme-affine crowds (the more, the merrier). Nothing to take too seriously and not to be played more than once a game night. At least by me.

item.name: Egizia
item.comment: First impression: Good game with interesting action selection mechanism, not to long. Lots of scoring in different ways, reminds me of Stone Age.

item.name: Elysium
item.comment: First impression: As expected from the rules read already, a game right up my alley! Simple mechanisms, but interesting choices with lots and lots of card combos to explore. There is also a nice level of player interaction, both positive and negative. The game was a tad on the long side (100min), but that will improve with experience, I hope.

item.name: Europa: Venedig ist ja klar, aber wo liegt Nessebar?
Family Business
item.conditiontext: english mayfair edition, complete and top condition!

item.name: Farmageddon
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Farmerama
item.comment: First impression: This game exactly simulates the browser game - it's totally solitaire! There is no real interaction with the other players, you just build your own fields up. After a few plays, you've seen everything. There is no variance or new elements.

item.name: Fauna
item.comment: First impression: Finaly a sort of quiz game i like!

item.name: Fief: France 1429
item.comment: Kickstarter June 2014 - received February 2015

item.name: Filou: Die Katze im Sack
item.originalname: Felix: The Cat in the Sack

item.name: Firenze
item.comment:
First impression: After a more than mediocre explanation at Spiel 2010 the game seems to be bland. I'll give it another try, hoping for more interesting things going on.
Second impression after 3 plays: upped my rating by 1. The game is OK for what it want to be.

item.name: A Fistful of Penguins
item.comment:
First impression: Nice little game with cute dice and PENGUINS! Played only with two, but had a blast! Hope for even more fun with more players going.
Second impression: Loads of fun with big groups also. Not sure about the kangaroos - are they to mighty?

item.name: Five Points: Gangs of New York
Florenza
item.comment: First impression: Wow, what a big game it is! You'll need an equally big table to play upon. The quality of components is great, the grafics superb, but due to the bigness you can't see everything at first glance, which is sometimes annoying. Gameplay suggests it would be smoother with lower count, but this may also be a matter of experience. I'm very eager to play again, alas, the steep price is a little hinderance ...

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: First impression: Light version of Pandemic; not really interesting. Nice bits but they do not much for me.

item.name: Fortuna
item.comment: As the title suggests, there is a lot of luck into FORTUNA. Too much for my guts, so I traded it away. I rather play a real dice game then!

item.name: Fresco
item.comment: First impression: beautiful game with fresh theme and good mechanics.

item.name: FÃ¼rstenfeld
item.comment: First impression: somewhat dry game, purely mechanical, but nice presented with cute wooden bits and good graphics. I Liked my First Game OK, but that's not enough to warrant a buy.

item.name: Fzzzt!
item.comment: First impression: Card game with auctions and set collecting. Nice graphics, surprisingly deep game play. More than a good filler!

item.name: The Game: Spiel...so lange du kannst!
Das Geheimnis von Monte Cristo
item.comment: First impression: kind of strange experience! Interesting new mechanism with the 'action slide', nice graphics and components, but dull und almost complete random game play. I see a lot of possibilities in there, but don't think I'll play it enough to exploit them.

item.name: Glen More
item.comment:
First impression: Played a final prototype copy at the "Rosenheimer SpielefrÃ¼hling". Nice gameplay with a lot of tension going on! Even after the first play, I can see different strategy paths to exploit, what i find really interesting. Definitivly getting me a copy ASAP!
Second impression: Having played some games (with my own, super-pimped copy) I find it still OK, but not great, especially with 5. 4 Players is the sweet spot for me.

item.name: Go West!
item.comment: Trade interest: high

item.name: The Golden City
item.comment: First impression: Woah, what a BORING experience! This game is so dull, even my nine year old wasn't overly engaged. And he really likes all sorts of new games... Maybe it's just not for me.
item.conditiontext: german edition, language independet. As new, played once.

item.name: Gonzaga
item.comment: First impression: Suprisingly interesting game, despite the somewhat "ugly" components. Skipped it in Essen2009, but was happy to give it a try now!

item.name: La Granja
item.comment: First impression: La Granja hits the sweet spot of complexity with me! Hope to play it a lot now, hope my wife likes it as much as Macao or Seasons!

item.name: Die HÃ¤ndler von Genua
item.comment: german

item.name: Hansa Teutonica
item.comment: First impression: very good strategic game with lots of interesting decisions to make. Bought in Essen09 and eager to play again soon!

item.name: Havana
item.comment:
first impression: interesting action selection mechanism, but with two player too low on interaction. Could be better with more.
second impression: Didn't get much better with more players, so it was traded away.

item.name: Die heisse Schlacht am kalten Buffet
Helvetia
item.comment: First impression: some new/interesting mechanics in here, but at it's core, it's worker placement as usual. The game feels very deterministic and i didn't like the fixed game end condition (20 VP or more), too. The representation with big tiles and a lot of wood for pawns and actions markers ist lovely, but the graphic style is not to my taste. Although the buildings and persons are very rich detailed, the whole look is like a 80ties computer game of "Settlers". And the box cover is completely misleading! How do you expect an german game when glancing on a swiss flag and the Matterhorn?!

item.name: Der Herr der Ringe: Das Kartenspiel
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

item.name: Herr der Ringe: Der Ringkrieg Collector's Edition
item.originalname: War of the Ring Collector's Edition

item.name: Der Herr der Ringe: Die Entscheidung
item.originalname: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation

item.name: Der Herr der Ringe: Die Suche
item.originalname: Lord of the Rings: The Search

item.name: Historia
item.comment: Spieleschmiede

item.name: Homesteaders
item.comment: First impression: After a long, long wait the game finally arrived and was played the same day! Good combination of auctions and ressource management. In our game, the bidding was always tense and we all enjoyed it very much. A good addition to my collection, glad i ordered it!

item.name: Im Schatten des Kaisers
item.originalname: In the Shadow of the Emperor

item.name: Im Wandel der Zeiten: Das WÃ¼rfelspiel â€“ Bronzezeit
item.originalname: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age

item.name: Indiana Jones: Auf der Jagd nach den verlorenen SchÃ¤tzen
Isla Dorada
item.comment: First impression: This game is pure chaos and a luck-fest, too! This combination kills it for me completely as it drags on much too long for its randomness.

item.name: Isle of Skye: Vom HÃ¤uptling zum KÃ¶nig
item.originalname: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
item.comment: First impression: Blech. What a luckfest. Played with five, it is: take what you get and make the best (or worst) out of it. And the tiebraking rule is quite harsh - three quys tied for first place? Each gets five points! Runnerup, who has one lousy thing less? Gets nothing! The game seems not to be for me, as I don't like SO MUCH RANDOMNESS in my games. Maybe I'll try it again with three or four players. Maybe not.

item.name: JÃ¤ger der Nacht
item.comment: First impression: Interesting variation of Werewolves, plays fast and easy. I'm not sure how much it is on the long run, but I'm willing to give it at go more often!

item.name: JÃ¤ger und Sammler
item.comment: First impression: too long and thinky for a "simple" game like this. Had hoped for more, i.e. more interesting game play, but it wasn't so.

item.name: Im Jahr des Drachen
item.originalname: In the Year of the Dragon

item.name: Jaipur
item.comment: First impression: Not interesting game play at all. Build a collection, cash it in, repeat. Boring.

item.name: Junta: Viva el Presidente!
item.comment: First impression: What a mess! Dice & cards at a maximum random level! Fun for what it is, but i don't want to play it again - ever.

item.name: Key West
item.comment: First impression: Interesting in the way that you have a lot of possibilities but can't do everything if you want to win. Concentration is the key here! I like the novel auction mechanic alot und also the grafics done be the newcomer Cosimo. I'm glad i bought it in Essen for a very reasonable price and hope to play it often!

item.name: Khronos
item.conditiontext: Matagot first edition with good wooden bits. Rules in english, french and german. Excellent condition, only played once.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment:
Boy, what a mess with 6 players! Just sit and wait until you get knocked out of the game and three or so players are getting to play at least a little bit tactical. But still, the game is horribly overproduced and not delivering.
Also, way to long for what it's worth - playing Yatzee couldn't be more annoying.
Give me ZombieDice or Fistful of Penguins any time above this piece of crap!

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment: very light game, not much to discover after some plays. Traded away.

item.name: Kleopatra und die Baumeister
item.originalname: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects

item.name: KÃ¶nig Artus und die Ritter der Tafelrunde
item.originalname: King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

item.name: Kopf an Kopf
item.comment: First impression: nicely presented bet-and-race-game for families. Purely luck-driven, but you can't real hope for more in this kind of game, can you?

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment:
First impression: Here we have really gorgeous components and nice graphics paired with interesting mechanisms, but none of them are new. Our first play took more than 2h, when the box says only 60min, but we had two AP-prone players in it. I liked the play and if it could be played in a hour or so, it could be a great middleweight game.
The play showed that different strategies are indeed applicable but i had wished for a little more involved game. The combat part is also highly abstract and very simple with close to none variation form game to game - same with the laws.
Second impression: The second play was MUCH faster (70min) and more enjoyable also. I still find the game a bit on the light side, but this is no bad sign.

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
Die Legenden von Andor: Orfen Sonder-Heldentableau
Libertalia
item.comment: First impression: Lighthearted game of card management, aimed at the family game market. Very nice graphics and smooth game play gives a hour of fun. The option to play with up to 6 players is nice, too.

item.name: Loch Ness
item.comment: First impression: Played with 5. Very light game without any meaningful decisions. Luck is dominating. Not my cup of tea.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Louis XIV: RÃ¤nkespiele am Hofe des SonnenkÃ¶nigs
Macao
item.comment:
First impression: Some nice new mechanism with the dice driven timewheel. Maybe a bit too much chaotic due to dice AND cards. Needs more plays to justify.
Update: After more than 30 plays (2 Player), i really like it and my significant other LOVES it! :-)

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment: Trade interest: low

item.name: March of the Ants
item.comment: Kickstarter January 2015 - received March 2015

item.name: Mensch Ã¤rgere Dich nicht: Das Kartenspiel
Merkator
item.comment: First impression: After some soloplays and one play with two I think we have a winner here! Not outstanding, but a solid game of planning and participating. I'd like to explore it further and hope for more plays soon. But be warned: People with AP may ruin your gaming experience herein!

item.name: Middle-Earth Quest
item.comment: First impression: Wow, that's a cool game! I'm not into dungeon crawls/Hero games at all, but this game i really like. Hope to play it more often soon!

item.name: Die Minen von Zavandor
item.comment: First impression: After a late night first play with heavy rules problems, the second game was very smooth and enjoyable. Nice graphics and some interesting decisions to make, there seem to be also a lot of different ways to score points. High on my wishlist!

item.name: Minister
item.comment:
Rolling a dice again and again, without any interesting decisions (because almost always there is a "best" move, mosttimes there is just one possible move, too) is pointless. 35 years ago, this game was good news to all Pachesi-players, but for now, it's way outdated.
Although, this could have been a fun game if it only plays under half an hour! ;)

item.name: Mombasa
item.comment: First impression: Complex Euro with interesting twists. Good planning will be rewarded; bad planning, well, too! Player interaction is subtle, but it is no typical multiplayer-solitaire. Theme integration is thin, but functionable. First play saw lots of mistakes by everyone, but was fun nonetheless. I'm eager to play again!

item.name: Mondo
item.comment: First impression: Light-hearted tile-placing game with (mild) time pressure. Nothing spectacular, aiming for the family-with-childs-marktet. I prefer Carcassonne, but would play it again.

item.name: Namibia
item.comment: First impression: Nice little game of exploration, transportation and price manipulation. Not too rules heavy, interesting choices are possible. But the pricing in Essen turned me way off - 35 Euro for a tiny game consisting of mostly used-before components? No Way!

item.name: Navegador
item.comment: First impression: After 1,5 plays, it seems to be more of a race game than anything else. I'm not sure if I like it.

item.name: Neuland
item.conditiontext: First edition - opened, but unplayed. Box is numbered "8/300" and is signed by both authors and both artists!

item.name: The New Era: Spiel 2011 Promo Pack
Noblemen
item.comment: First impression: great production value with lots of wood and cardboard pieces, nicely illustrated. Game is much faster and unforgiving than one might expect. Lots of different approaches seem to be possible.

item.name: Norenberc
item.comment: First impression: very nice production quality with big wooden pawns and thick cardboard tiles. Game is lighter than it seems to be, but that is no bad thing. Can get a little long when people overthinking the simple structures.

item.name: Nox
item.comment: First impression: A card game where your decisions mean nothing because game play is complete random. A rather play Yatzee ...

item.name: Olympos
item.comment: First impression: A nice, fast playing civ-building game with lots of direct player interaction. Played with three and liked it, but i assume it's better with four or five players.

item.name: One More Barrel
item.comment: I would rate it a 7, but the rules are SO BAD WRITTEN, i had to cut a point! The first play was a total mess and i have to look up a lot of details before bringing it on the table again!

item.name: Origin
item.comment:
First impression: Visually impressive game - lots of lovely wooden meeples! Gameplay is fast and has room for interesting decisions.
Second impression: After more plays, I like the game even more and have upped my rating to 9! Great game that plays in a short time.

item.name: Der Palast von Alhambra: Die Schatzkammer des Kalifen â€“ Die 4. Erweiterung
Die PalÃ¤ste von Carrara
item.comment: First impression: another good HiG-Game with quite nice components and great artwork. The family game is exactly what you would expect: easy to grasp and fine to play!

item.name: Panamax
item.comment:
Overly long, even with fast players. Very bad rulebook, easily in the top ten of the worst rulebooks I've ever read.
The dice "jump" mechanic is a joke and improper for a strategy game. Planning is not possible, if you find a suitable dice at the start of your turn - fine. If not, you're kicked.
Easy way to win: Take a directory action early in the first round and push your share price up. Then disallow anyone else to do so by dragging the directory dice away everytime it is your turn. You not only get bigger amounts of cash infusion in your firm when shares get bought. You're also set to win the directory bonus chit every round!

item.name: Pantheon
item.comment: First Impression: gorgeous graphics and components meets clever Game Play = very good Game! It reminds me of Stone Age in terms of complexity (and Box Size, btw.). Different strategies are possible, the luck of the draw is here, but seems not dominant. I'm very eager to play again soon!

item.name: Der Pate
item.comment: First impression: Good example for a "game by a film", nice and rich graphics and a lot of "flair". Nonetheless, the iconolgy could be clearer and some player handouts would help, too. Gameplay is easy, but interesting. But you have to keep up with a lot of "take that" moments!

item.name: PAX
item.comment: Played the prototype a few months ago and liked it very much! The graphic design by Klemens Franz looks great also. Should be a clear winner for Irongames!

item.name: Pentago
item.comment: german Kosmos edition

item.name: Pergamemnon
item.comment: Played the prototpye months ago and liked it very much. Due to the five different nations and lots of mythical creatures, the games were very different. Nice new approach to deck-building indeed!

item.name: Pergamon
item.comment:
First impression: Very nice production quality with cute artwork. Only played it once with 2, the "graverobber" works well, but human players would surely add more depth and decisions. Looking forward to play it again soon!
Second impression: Now played with four - much more interaction and interesting decisions. Very fine family game, glad to own it!

item.name: PfeffersÃ¤cke
item.conditiontext: german edition, but language independent. Like new condition!

item.name: Pharao
item.comment: I bought the game as it was brandnew at the market - 23 years ago! That's cool, because I own not much for so long...

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Builders Duel
Die Pinguine aus Madagascar: Auf und Davon!
Plateau X
item.comment: First impression: Light, tactical tile laying, path building game with a not so new twist how to move your pawn. No bad experience, but nothing i real enjoy.

item.name: Principato
item.comment:
First impression: PRINCIPATO is a game of stripped down mechanics, nothing more than the core was left. This is not bad, but it leaves a problem, at least for me: If you don't really enjoy THIS mechanic, there is nothing more to love herein!
All in all, I find the game too simple. You can trace a strategy mosttimes, but this strategy is dictated by the two goal cards you got at the very beginning. If you don't try to fullfil at least one, you won't have a chance on winning.

item.name: Queen's Architect
item.comment: First impression: "Kennerspiel"-weighted game with an interesting "personal rondell" mechanism. Very low on interaction, even with four players. Would try it again, but expecting to find it to dry on the long run.

item.name: R-Eco
item.comment: First impression: clever little game with cute graphics on the german Amigo edition. Like to play more.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Auf der Schwelle zum Krieg
item.originalname: Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Aufziehender Sturm
item.originalname: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebellen vs. Imperium
item.originalname: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium

item.name: Raiders of the North Sea
item.comment: Kickstarter - December 2015 - delivered December 2015

item.name: Railways of the World: The Card Game
Raja: Palastbau in Indien
item.originalname: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
item.conditiontext: german Phalanx Games edition - new in shrinkwarp!

item.name: Rapa Nui
item.comment: First impression: Laying cards and taking cards - there is not much going on here at all! The new scoring mechanic is nice and game play is rather fast, but most decisions are no-brainers at best. Also, the game ends quickly, with lots of cards not getting played.

item.name: Rio de la Plata
item.comment: First impression: Wow, this is an example for putting way to much mechanics in just one game! Also, the explanation in Essen was horrible. Don't know if this gets a second chance, don't think so now.

item.name: Risk: Balance of Power
item.comment: First impression: Played the basic version with the son. Not really impressive - it's Risk, so what? Hoped for more, but this comes with the advanced version.

item.name: Ruhrschifffahrt 1769-1890
item.comment: First impression: All the mechanics fits the theme extremely well, liked my first play alot!

item.name: Samarkand: Wege zum Reichtum
item.comment: First impression: Clever train game in here! ;-) Age of Scheme got a nice remake with very good artwork and bits. I liked the first play a lot, will definitely try to get my hands on a copy!

item.name: Savannah Tails
item.comment: First impression. Light racing game with cute ostrich meeples. Plays easy.

item.name: Schweinebande
item.comment: First impression: Nice little game with cute graphics but for me just too chaotic. Played with five but i have no hopes it would be better with less. Decent filler, nothing more.

item.name: Seeland
item.comment: First impression: Some new ideas to the genre of tilelaying in here. I esspecially like the money mechanism, this is a very elegant one! Comes with builtin variants so you can choose to play more family-oriented or to have a more gamers game. All in all very nice and my sig.o. also likes it! ;-)

item.name: SeidenstraÃŸe
item.comment: First impression: Nice game of set collecting in different ways. Good production value with a doublesided map, tokens and jewelry. Nothing really new in here, but OK for a "first" big game.

item.name: Shakespeare
item.comment: First Impression: Some nice ideas here, but nothing real exciting. Also some small problems, which add up and make the game less enjoyable for me. Examples: bad iconography, disctracting illustrations on Cards, much downtime, unbalanced Cards (some cards are clearly always better than others), small deck of cards may lead to uninteresting replays.

item.name: Shipyard
item.comment: First impression: Surprisingly boring game, but we made also a little error. Maybe it will get better with another play.

item.name: Siam
item.comment: First impression: Very nice presented thinking game. There seems to be a lot of depth in there, but only one play can't justify. Expensive, if you like to have one of the bigger editions.

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel â€“ 10th Anniversary Special Edition Tin Box
Die Siedler von Catan: Das schnelle Kartenspiel
Small World
item.comment: A good Vinci remake - even better than expected!

item.name: Snapshot
item.comment: First impression: Not a game for me! Just fingerflicking isn't much fun in my book.

item.name: Die Speicherstadt
item.comment: First impression: Interesting mechanism, but not much game in here. Need more plays!

item.name: Splendor
item.comment:
First impression: Nice bits and graphics, but gameplay leaves me a little cold. Almost no interaction and no tabletalk make this games not really entertaining for me. Maybe this changes with more plays, but I have doubts ...
Second impression: I think this games shines with two or three players most. With four players (or even five, we tried this with a simple variant) there is too much going on between my turns. Nothing is really planable so the game becomes a real luckfest.

item.name: Stay Away!
item.comment: Holy crap! What a pile of ...! Get this game if half of your group likes to just sit around and do nothing because that's what will happen all the time! Oh, and the other half will have to make uninformed decisions until all of your group is bored enough to end this tragedy. Stay away!

item.name: Steam Time
item.comment: First impression: Ah, RÃ¼diger Dorn made a Gamers Game again! The theme is thin, but the mechanism is great. Action drafting aka Worker Placement is the engine, lots of decisions to take and no one is easy. Collect lots of crystals to take better actions later. But VP costs you crystals, too! When to do what? And will your fellow gamers cross your finelayed plans? Again?! I enjoyed my first play very much and be eager to play it again soon.

item.name: Strada Romana
item.comment: First impression: Played with two. Not much decision, just set collecting and a little race betting. Hope for a better expierence with more players.

item.name: Strasbourg
item.comment: First impression: This game only uses one mechanism - blind bidding. You have almost no control over your fate, you only real decision is how many cards you draw at the start of a round! The game plays fast and has a nice presentation, but aside from that, there is way to much luck and player chaos in it for me!

item.name: Take It or Leave It
item.comment: First impression: Fast dice/card game with lots of luck included. Normally, i shy away from such games, but this is not as bad as it seems. Would play it again.

item.name: Taluva
item.comment: HiG edition - like new

item.name: Tasnia
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Templar Queenie 2: The Secret Letters, The Tapestries & The Lamps
Templar: The Secret Treasures
item.comment: First impression: wunderful produced game of card-driven moving around. We played with five, so the last player seemed to be in disadvantage position. And the game took way to long with five. Will try it again with four.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Thurn und Taxis: Der Kurier der FÃ¼rstin
Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
Tiny Epic Galaxies
item.comment: Kickstarter September 2015 - received October 2015

item.name: Titania
item.comment: First impression: A good name, nice bits and fine graphic quality don't make always a good game! Boring experience of opportunities you get or ... not.

item.name: Tonga Island
item.comment: Boring with children > 7. Not much game in it, but nice components.

item.name: Die Tore der Welt
item.comment: First impression: Quite not a sequel to Pillars of the Earth, a good and interesting game for FOUR. Won't like to try it with two or even three, because the main mechanism really works only with four people playing! Good enough to hunt it down for my collection.

item.name: Toscana
item.comment: First impression: The very minimalistic design and the cartoony grafics turned me down. Maybe there is a good game in it, but I can't see it. Only three actions every turn in almost always logical order gives not much to think upon. Player chaos can destroy your plans often, which is also nothing I like. Would play it again, but not suggest.

item.name: Tournay
item.comment: First impression: Nice tactical card game, but not TROYES' little brother. Had hoped for more, but in the end, luck of the draw IS important. Not bad, but no highlight either.

item.name: Trajan
item.comment: Very well composed game with a new and interesting action selection mechanism. Lot's of different areas to act on, but very low player interaction.

item.name: Tschakka Lakka: Die rasante WÃ¼rfeljagd nach dem Tempelschatz
Turandot
item.comment: First impression: Light card auction game with nothing new in it. I had high hopes for this, but find it very unimpressive.

item.name: Ugg-Tect
item.comment: First impression: Funny little game for 2 teams, more of a social event than a game. You'll get alot of laughs out of it, but i don't think that there is much replayability in it.

item.name: Um Reifenbreite
item.conditiontext: german edition, not language dependant. very good condition.

item.name: Vasco da Gama
item.comment: First impression: Worker placement game with nice new twists. Very good experience in the first game, hope for more!

item.name: Il Vecchio
item.comment: First impression: Lots of micro management of getting the right ressources at the right time to benefit most. Been there, done that a thousend times. No new elements, but a solid design. I had hoped for more, but oh my ...

item.name: Velo City
item.comment: First impression: With some rules-tweaking, you get a decent dice-driven racing game. Nothing really new here, but also nothing bad.

item.name: Via Appia
item.comment: First impression: simple family-style game with a nice gimmick in the slider. Plays OK but lacks tension, most decisions are obvious. Probably not my cup of tea, may be better when played with kids.

item.name: VivaJava
item.originalname: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game

item.name: VivaJava: The Coffee Game
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Vor den Toren von Loyang
item.comment: First impression after Sologame: Wow, that gives you something to think on. Very good design, very promising for a 2 or 3 Player game in the near future!

item.name: Wampum
item.comment: First impression: That's all?! Lay card(s), get card(s)? Had hoped for more here, but sadly, it wasn't. Will try once more to justify...

item.name: Wars of the Roses: Lancaster vs. York
Workshop of the World
item.comment: First impression: Very good and thematic auction game! While the graphics are a little substandard, the game is fun, not to long and has a lot of tension. Well done, Ragnars!
